intro: Trigonella microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited fenugreek, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. Trigonella microcarpa is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and agricultural contexts.
